alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 22 at 3:16PM EDT until April 22 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Cumberland. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, A slow moving and back-building storm has been producing heavy rainfall as it moves through the northern portion of Harnett County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Fort Bragg, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Wade, Falcon, Linden, Bonnie Doone and Vander. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
